greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n multiplied by the sum of its squarefree divisors (A048250(n)).
comment: Sum of reciprocals converges to Pi^2/6. The natural density of positive integers m such that A003557(m) = n equals 6/(a(n)*Pi^2).
If m is coprime to 6, a(3m) = a(4m).
Apparently the absolute values of the Dirichlet inverse of A000082. - _R. J. Mathar_, Mar 14 2011
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Dirichlet g.f. zeta(s-1)*zeta(s-2)/zeta(2*s-4). - _R. J. Mathar_, Mar 14 2011
G.f.: x*f'(x), where f(x) = Sum_{k>=1} mu(k)^2*k*x^k/(1 - x^k). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Apr 10 2017
maple: A181797 := proc(n) local f; f := ifactors(n)[2] ;  mul( op(1,d)^op(2,d)*( op(1,d)+1),d=f) ; end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Dec 05 2010
program: (Sage) A181797 = lambda n: n * sum(d for d in divisors(n) if is_squarefree(d)) # _D. S. McNeil_, Dec 05 2010
results.author: _Matthew Vandermast_, Dec 05 2010
